verses.text: Now King David was old and advanced in years, and even when they covered him with blankets, he could not keep warm.
verses.comment: Literal translation of phrase 'stricken in years.'

verses.text: So his servants said to him, 'Let a young virgin be sought for my lord the king, and let her stand before the king, and let her care for him. And let her lie in your arms, so that my lord the king may be warm.'
verses.comment: 'Lie in your arms' is a literal rendering; this was considered medicinal, not sexual.

verses.text: So they searched for a beautiful young woman throughout all the territory of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
verses.comment: Abishag's location preserved; 'Shunammite' refers to Shunem.

verses.text: The young woman was very beautiful; and she cared for the king and served him, but the king did not have sexual relations with her.
verses.comment: Clarifies that 'knew her not' refers to no sexual relationship.

verses.text: Now Adonijah the son of Haggith lifted himself up, saying, 'I will be king.' And he prepared for himself chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.comment: Phrase 'lifted himself up' preserves Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: His father had never at any time displeased him by asking, 'Why have you done this?' He was also a very handsome man, and was born next after Absalom.
verses.comment: Phrasing preserves literal sense of David's lack of discipline.

verses.text: He conferred with Joab son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the priest, and they supported Adonijah and helped him.
verses.comment: 'Helped him' is a clear modern equivalent for 'helped after Adonijah.'

verses.text: But Zadok the priest, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and David's mighty men were not with Adonijah.
verses.comment: Lists preserved as in original.

verses.text: Adonijah sacrificed sheep, oxen, and fattened calves by the Stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En Rogel. He invited all his brothers, the king's sons, and all the men of Judah, the king's servants,
but he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the mighty men, or Solomon his brother.
Then Nathan spoke to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, 'Have you not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith has become king, and our lord David does not know it?'
Now therefore come, let me give you advice, so that you may save your own life and the life of your son Solomon.

'Go in at once to King David, and say to him, “My lord the king, did you not swear to your servant, saying, ‘Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne’? Why then is Adonijah king?”'
verses.comment: 'Swear to your servant' is a close rendering; quotation marked for clarity.

verses.text: 'While you are still speaking with the king, I also will come in after you and confirm your words.'
So Bathsheba went to the king in his room. Now the king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite was serving the king.
Bathsheba bowed and paid homage to the king, and the king said, 'What is your request?'
She said to him, 'My lord, you swore to your servant by the LORD your God, saying, “Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne.”'
'And now, see, Adonijah is king, although you, my lord the king, do not know about it.'

'He has sacrificed oxen, fattened calves, and sheep in abundance, and has invited all the king’s sons, Abiathar the priest, and Joab the commander of the army, but he did not invite Solomon your servant.'
'And you, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, to tell them who will sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.'
'Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king sleeps with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon will be counted as offenders.'
verses.comment: 'Sleeps with his fathers' is a literal rendering for 'dies.'

verses.text: While she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.
They told the king, 'Nathan the prophet is here.' So he came in before the king and bowed with his face to the ground before the king.
And Nathan said, 'My lord the king, have you said, “Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?”'
verses.comment: Direct quotation with punctuation for clarity.

verses.text: 'For he has gone down this day and has sacrificed oxen, fattened calves, and sheep in abundance. He has invited all the king’s sons, the commanders of the army, and Abiathar the priest. Now they are eating and drinking before him, and saying, “Long live King Adonijah!”'
'But me, your servant, Zadok the priest, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon, he has not invited.'
'Has this thing been done by my lord the king, and you have not told your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?'
Then King David answered and said, 'Call Bathsheba to me.' So she came into the king’s presence and stood before the king.
And the king swore, saying, 'As the LORD lives, who has redeemed my soul out of every distress,
just as I swore to you by the LORD, the God of Israel, saying, “Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place,” so I will do this day.'
Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the ground and paid homage to the king, and said, 'May my lord King David live forever!'
King David said, 'Call to me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada.' So they came before the king.
And the king said to them, 'Take with you the servants of your lord and have Solomon my son ride on my own mule, and bring him down to Gihon.'
verses.comment: 'My own mule' preserved as in Hebrew.

verses.text: There let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him king over Israel. Blow the trumpet and say, “Long live King Solomon!”
You shall then come up after him, and he shall come and sit on my throne. For he shall reign in my place; I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.'
verses.comment: 'Ruler' is literal for Hebrew 'nagid.'

verses.text: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada answered the king, 'Amen! May the LORD, the God of my lord the king, say so too.
As the LORD has been with my lord the king, so may he be with Solomon, and may he make his throne greater than the throne of my lord King David.'
So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites, and the Pelethites went down and had Solomon ride on King David's mule and led him to Gihon.
verses.comment: Cherethites and Pelethites: royal bodyguard units.

verses.text: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil from the tent and anointed Solomon. They blew the trumpet, and all the people said, 'Long live King Solomon!'
verses.comment: 'From the tent' refers to the tabernacle used for worship.

verses.text: And all the people went up after him, playing pipes and rejoicing with great joy, so that the earth was split by their noise.
verses.comment: Hebrew idiom 'earth was split by their noise' preserved.

verses.text: Adonijah and all the guests who were with him heard it as they finished eating. When Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, 'Why is there such a noise in the city?'
While he was still speaking, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came. Adonijah said, 'Come in, for you are a worthy man and bring good news.'
verses.comment: 'Worthy man' literal translation of 'man of valor.'

verses.text: But Jonathan answered Adonijah, 'No! For our lord King David has made Solomon king.'
'The king has sent with Solomon Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and they have made him ride on the king’s mule.'
'Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king at Gihon, and they have gone up from there rejoicing, so that the city is in an uproar. This is the noise you have heard.'
'Solomon now sits on the royal throne.'

'Moreover, the king’s servants came to bless our lord King David, saying, “May your God make the name of Solomon more famous than your name, and may he make his throne greater than your throne.” And the king bowed himself on his bed.'
verses.comment: 'Bowed himself on his bed' is a literal rendering.

verses.text: And the king also said, 'Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who has granted one of my offspring to sit on my throne this day, my own eyes seeing it.'
Then all the guests of Adonijah, afraid, rose and went each his own way.
And Adonijah, fearing Solomon, got up and went and took hold of the horns of the altar.
verses.comment: 'Horns of the altar' was a place of asylum in ancient Israel.

verses.text: Now it was told Solomon, 'See, Adonijah fears King Solomon, for he has laid hold of the horns of the altar, saying, “Let King Solomon swear to me first that he will not put his servant to death with the sword.”'
And Solomon said, 'If he shows himself a worthy man, not one of his hairs shall fall to the earth; but if wickedness is found in him, he shall die.'
verses.comment: Idiomatic phrase rendered literally.

verses.text: So King Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. He came and paid homage to King Solomon. And Solomon said to him, 'Go to your house.'
verses.comment: 'Paid homage' for the Hebrew 'bowed himself.'
